description:
exp/html: allow frameset if body contains whitespace

If the body of an HTML document contains text, the <frameset> tag is
ignored. But not if the text is only whitespace.

Pass 4 additional tests.

messages.text:
Hello nigeltao@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=6eb7e61b5286 ***

exp/html: allow frameset if body contains whitespace

If the body of an HTML document contains text, the <frameset> tag is
ignored. But not if the text is only whitespace.

Pass 4 additional tests.

R=nigeltao
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6442043

Committer: Nigel Tao <nigeltao@golang.org>

On Jul 24, 2012, at 7:09 PM, nigeltao@golang.org wrote:

> Ugh.

I'll second that. I tried four different parsers on one of the test inputs and got four different parse trees. Html5lib recently changed what they return for that input, but it isn't right yet.

subject: code review 6442043: exp/html: allow frameset if body contains whitespace
